alert.note: Alert for Northwestern Burlington; Ocean; Western Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 7:16PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Ocean and northeastern Burlington Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 715 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pemberton, or 17 miles south of Trenton, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Presidential Lakes Estates, Pemberton, Wrightstown, Presidential Lakes, Browns Mills, Jobstown, Leisuretowne, Georgetown, Country Lake Estates, Pemberton Heights, New Egypt, Fort Dix and McGuire AFB. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southern and central New Jersey.
